intro: Clematis bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa Clematis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a deciduous vine that produces showy, blue to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound leaves with three to five leaflets and is characterized by its distinctive bracts that resemble small leaves. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Clematis bracteosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
